Key Match Events: India registered their highest ever score against Australia in the T20I
Cameron Green took the limelight in the first half of the innings
Matthew Wade's match-winning innings helped Australia get over the line
Post-Match Reflections: India failed to defend 209 as Australia sealed a 1-0 series lead in Mohali
Rohit Sharma praised the batters for posting a 200-plus score but added that the bowlers were not up to the mark and the fielding did not help
Miscellaneous Highlights: India became the first team to fail to defend 200-plus totals in T20Is at home more than once in a calendar year
They are also only the second team after South Africa in 2016 among full members of the ICC to end up on losing side despite posting 200 or more on the board
Others: Bhuvneshwar Kumar conceded 52 runs, while Harshal leaked 49
Rohit Sharma praised Hardik for his super 71-run knock
India will need to look at the bowling woes before the second T20I
